Sentencas: The cermet of Ni-oxide ion conductor is widely used as an anode in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: In Operando Raman Spectroscopy Study on Oxygen Chemical Potential Change in Ni-SDC Cermet Anode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, the usage of nickel induces various degradation phenomena during discharge operation; e.g., agglomeration and/or oxidation of nickel catalyst, and carbon deposition.
Titulo: In Operando Raman Spectroscopy Study on Oxygen Chemical Potential Change in Ni-SDC Cermet Anode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In most cases, these degradation phenomena are triggered by the change in the oxygen chemical potential inside the anode.
Titulo: In Operando Raman Spectroscopy Study on Oxygen Chemical Potential Change in Ni-SDC Cermet Anode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this study, then, in operando Raman spectroscopy was conducted for the anode of Ni-Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-delta (Ni-SDC) cermet at 700 degrees C with applying SDC as a probe for the detection of oxygen chemical potential.
Titulo: In Operando Raman Spectroscopy Study on Oxygen Chemical Potential Change in Ni-SDC Cermet Anode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This is because the band related to the oxygen vacancy in the Raman spectrum of SDC varies depending on the partial pressure of oxygen in the ambient atmosphere.
Titulo: In Operando Raman Spectroscopy Study on Oxygen Chemical Potential Change in Ni-SDC Cermet Anode for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The change in oxygen chemical potential at the top surface of anode was successfully quantified under polarization.
